header.title: CosTransactions_Coordinator

erlref.modulesummary: This module implements the OMG CosTransactions::Coordinator interface.

description.p:
To get access to the record definitions for the structures use:
-include_lib("cosTransactions/include/CosTransactions.hrl").

desc.p: A new subtransaction is created whose parent is the Coordinator argument.

list.item: 'SubtransactionsUnavailable' - if nested transactions are not supported.
'Inactive' - if target transaction has already been prepared.

func.name: get_transaction_name(Coordinator) -> Name
func.fsummary: Return the name associated with the object.

desc.p: Returns a printable string, which describe the transaction. The main purpose is to support debugging.

func.name: get_parent_status(Coordinator) -> Status
func.fsummary: Return the status of the parent transaction.

desc.p: Returns the status of the parent transaction associated with the target object. If the target object is a top-level transaction this operation is equivalent to get_status/1 operation.

func.name: get_status(Coordinator) -> Status
func.fsummary: Return the status of the transaction associated with the target object

desc.p: Returns the status of the transaction associated with the target object.

func.name: get_top_level_status(Coordinator) -> Status
func.fsummary: Return the status of the top-level transaction associated with the target object

desc.p: Returns the status of the top-level transaction associated with the target object.

func.name: hash_top_level_tran(Coordinator) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return a hash code for the top-level transaction associated with the target object

desc.p: Returns a hash code for the top-level transaction associated with the target object. Equals the operation hash_transaction/1 if the target object is a top-level transaction.

func.name: hash_transaction(Coordinator) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return a hash code for the transaction associated with the target object.

desc.p: Returns a hash code for the transaction associated with the target object.

func.name: is_descendant_transaction(Coordinator, OtherCoordinator) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return a boolean which indicates whether the transaction associated with the target object is a descendant of the transaction associated with the parameter object

desc.p: Returns true if the transaction associated with the target object is a descendant of the transaction associated with the parameter object.

func.name: is_same_transaction(Coordinator, OtherCoordinator) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return true if the transaction associated with the target object is related to the transaction associated with the parameter object

desc.p: Returns true if the transaction associated with the target object is related to the transaction associated with the parameter object.

func.name: is_top_level_transaction(Coordinator) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return true if the transaction associated with the target object is a top-level transaction

desc.p: Returns true if the transaction associated with the target object is a top-level transaction.

func.name: register_resource(Coordinator, Resource) -> RecoveryCoordinator
func.fsummary: Register the parameter Resourceobject as a participant in the transaction associated with the target object

desc.p: This operation registers the parameter Resource object as a participant in the transaction associated with the target object. The RecoveryCoordinator returned by this operation can be used by this Resource during recovery.

note.p: The Resources will be called in FIFO-order when preparing or committing. Hence, be sure to register the Resources in the correct order.

list.item: 'Inactive' - if target transaction has already been prepared.

func.name: register_subtran_aware(Coordinator, SubtransactionAwareResource) -> Return
func.fsummary: Register the parameter SubtransactionAwareResourceobject such that it will be notified when the transaction, associated wit the target object, has committed or rolled back

desc.p: This operation registers the parameter SubtransactionAwareResource object such that it will be notified when the transaction, associated wit the target object, has committed or rolled back.

note.p: The Resources will be called in FIFO-order. Hence, be sure to register the Resources in the correct order.

func.name: rollback_only(Coordinator) -> Return
func.fsummary: Modify the transaction associated with the target object so the only possible outcome is to rollback the transaction

desc.p: The transaction associated with the target object is modified so the only possible outcome is to rollback the transaction.
